Name: Bernice
Ingredients: 10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of mint leaf pegged to rim or the very tip of mint sprig to float.
Garnish with mint leaf pegged to rim or float the tip of mint sprig.
Review: Best described as "A vodka daiquiri with a hint of herbal peppermint courtesy of Galliano."
History: Created by "C. S. Berner", this cocktail first appears as the winning cocktail at a 1950 bartender's competition in The U.K.B.G. Guide to Drinks 1st edition published 1953 [and not in Ted Saucier's 1951 Bottoms Up! as we were previously led to believe. Having checked, I can't see it in Saucier's book.]
Nutrition: One serving of Bernice contains 172 calories
